title: Around the Districts : Manorhamilton , Merville Centre , Riverstown and Skreen - Dromard
body_text:
Around the Districts: Manorhamilton, Merville Centre, Riverstown and Skreen-Dromard
Around the Districts
Manorhamilton
Missing Visitor’s Book
The famous and historic Glencar Tea Shed, whose current proprietor is Helen Siberry, has made an appeal for the return of an early Tea Shed visitor’s book that has been missing since the 1970s after the book had been lent to someone around a half century ago.
In her appeal Helen says “help needed. While closed, we’ve been exploring the history of Siberry’s Cottage, the original tea house run by Robert and Margaret Siberry and their family. Family folklore speaks of an early visitors’ book signed by W. B Yeats, dating from the late 1800s/early 1900s.
“The earliest book we have starts in 1942. It’s believed Uncle Dick loaned the earlier book to someone in the 1970s, possibly for research, and it was never returned. If you know where it might be, we’d love to hear from you: glencarteashed@gmail.com.
“We’d also love your memories of the old cottage,” Helen also added. Hopefully the pre 1942 Glencar Tea Shed visitor’s book will be located.
Mental Health Help
The national mental health organisation GROW is offering help to anyone who is having difficulties with anxiety, depression or loneliness. Locally in Leitrim and surrounding areas GROW is also encouraging anyone with mental health concerns to drop into them in Carrick-on-Shannon’s Breffni Family Resource Centre on Wednesdays between 11 a.m. to 1 p.m.
A spokesperson for GROW asks, “Are you struggling with anxiety, depression, or loneliness?” The spokesperson answers “you’re not alone. If life feels overwhelming and you’re not sure where to turn, GROW is here for you. “GROW is a national mental health organisation offering support to people who are experiencing or have experienced mental health challenges. We invite you to join our friendly, strictly confidential, and non-judgemental weekly peer support meetings in Breffni FRC, Carrick-on-Shannon every Wednesday from 11 a.m. to 1 p.m. “You don’t have to face this alone. With GROW, you’ll find understanding, connection, and hope. For more information call Marie at 086 8516939.”
Celebrating St Brigid’s Day
All are invited by the North Leitrim Women’s Centre to drop by to the Bee Park Community Centre on Friday, January 30, to celebrate St Brigid’s Day.
In their invitation to all a spokesperson for the Women’s Centre says “join us to celebrate St Brigid’s Day on Friday, January 30, from 10.30 a.m. to 12.30 p.m. in the Bee Park Community Centre where there will be a reflection and connection facilitated by Marie Evans.
“After Marie’s reflection and connection performance is over – it will be followed by tea and treats, and plenty of chat as we weave crosses together.”
Women Centre’s SNA Course
The North Leitrim Women’s Centre QQI Level 5 Special Needs Assistants and Work Placement course will take place in the Bee Park Community Centre on Mondays and Tuesdays between February and May this year from 10 a.m. to 3 p.m. each day.
This course is free of charge. It will provide an excellent opportunity to retrain for this career path. To book a place on course please contact the North Leitrim Women’s Centre, phone 071 9856220.
District News Deadline
Please email all notes for next week’s Sligo Champion Manorhamilton District News to PJ Leddy – leddypatrick10@gmail.com by 6 p.m. at the latest on Thursday, January 29.
Merville Centre
PENDANT ALARMS
Merville Community Centre facilitate on behalf of our community the provision to eligible persons of Social Monitored Pendant Alarms, under the Seniors Alert Scheme that is administered by Pobal Equipment Funding is available for eligible persons over 65 years for the installation of an monitored alarm on a landline in the person’s home. The alarms are now available for persons aged 65 or older and living alone, living with another person who meets the terms and conditions, living alone for significant periods of time during the day, or is a carer to someone else in their household. First year monitoring is free for all new applicants. Subsequent annual monitoring charges are then payable by the user. Other Systems are available at various costs for those who do not possess a Landline. Overall this monitoring product adds Peace of Mind for Both the Users, family and Friends at minimal cost. Contact Merville Centre Office at 071 9150029 for further information.
Riverstown
September Enrolment
Ardkeeran National School, Riverstown is now accepting enrolments for September 2026. Any parent wishing to enrol their child should contact the school by email at admin@ardkeeran.com or by telephone. This is a five teacher school located in the village of Riverstown. To find out more about the school visit the Facebook page Ardkeeran NS Riverstown or website ardkeerannsriverstown.ie/enrolment and download the Admission Policy, Enrolment Form and Admission Notice.
DINNER DANCE
The annual Shamrock Gaels dinner dance will take place on the Bank Holiday weekend Sunday, February 1. Traditionally a fantastic night it will also be a opportunity to celebrate the all conquering Men’s Senior Team, winning the league and championship along with the Ladies’ Senior team who were runners-up in the Junior A championship. Tickets are available from any committee member.
TRACTOR RUN
A Tractor Run will take place on St Brigid’s Bank Holiday, Monday, February 2, leaving from Sooey Hall. Registration for this event will be at midday and the run which is open to tractors and vintage cars will begin at 2 p.m. A cake sale will take place simultaneously from midday to 3 p.m. in Sooey Hall. Grant match funding is required to allow work on Phase two of the hall upgrade to begin in May. Phase two will include upgrading bathrooms to accommodate wheelchair accessibility, provision of shower facilities, public office space, external surface improvement and an enlarged stage area and meeting room. Alongside this restructuring will be thermal insulation and rewiring throughout the building. A target of €10,000 needs to be raised in order to progress this project in 2026.
FOLK PARK JOB OPPORTUNITY
Sligo Folk Park requires a part time Maintenance Technician. Duties include but are not limited to grass cutting, landscaping, painting, clearing gutters, assisting with set up of events and historical exhibits etc. Candidate must be comfortable working as part of a team but also able to work under their own initiative. CSP requirements apply to this employment. To apply please send a CV to info@sligofolkpark.com or for more information telephone 071 9165001.
FUNDRAISING CONCERT
Glór na dTonn, all-Ireland Champions 2025, will take part in a fundraising concert with in memory of Paul and Linda Judge on Friday, February 6, at 8 p.m., (doors open at 7.30 p.m.). All proceeds in aid of Mayo Roscommon Hospice. Concert takes place in the Great National Hotel, Ballina (F26 X5P3).Tickets are €25 and available on the Mayo Roscommon Hospice website.
CONCERT
Gerry Guthrie and his band Concert Tour with Special Guest TR Dallas will be in the Coleman Music Centre (F56 TF88) on Thursday, January 29, at 8 p.m. Tickets cost €27.50. To book telephone 071 9182599 or visit our website colemanirishmusic.com.
COMMUNITY NOTES
Please email carrowcashel@eircom.net or alternatively text or call Iris at 086 8258525 to have news items included in Riverstown Community News.
Skreen-Dromard
Active Retirement Group
The Skreen-Dromard Community Care Active Retirement Group have resumed their weekly Chair Yoga meetings in the Skreen Health Centre on Wednesdays from 11 p.m. to midday. Gentle Chair based exercise suitable for everyone. All welcome every Wednesday.
Track Walks
The local St Patrick’s GAA Club is inviting everyone to the Skreen-Dromard Community Centre Track every Thursday night form 7 p.m. to 8 p.m. – for the coming four weeks as part of ‘Ireland Lights Up’. These walks are open to all Members and non-Members alike. The Track lights will be on for a safe and social evening. The club look forward to seeing the local community out and getting active together.
January Social Dances
The Second Social Dance for the month of January in the Skreen-Dromard Community Centre will take place on Saturday, January 31, with music supplied by Bernie Heaney. Dancing from 9 p.m. and everyone welcome.
Alanon
Alanon is a Support Group for anyone who is affected by someone else’s Alcohol or Drug addiction. To find out more about this group contact 01 8732699 for info where the nearest meeting takes place.
Indoor Walking Football
Following a successful Demo Day of Walking Football, a Weekly Class will start in the New Year, the start date for this event will be Thursday, January 8, at midday in the Skreen-Dromard Community Centre and will continue every Thursday for five weeks. The fee for this event is €25 paid on the first day or €7 per class. Everyone, who is interested is encouraged to commit to attending in order to have enough people participating.
If you or someone you know is interested, contact the community centre office at 087 6649635.
Monthly Bereavement Support Group
The February Monthly Meeting of the Bereavement Group will take place in the Newman Institute on Wednesday, February 11, at 8 p.m. For further information contact 096 72066. Everyone welcome.
Dromore West Sings Concert
The Dromore West Sings Concert will take place on February 13 and 14 in Templeboy Church. Tickets are now on sale.
Links to purchase tickets will be posted on all their social media pages from then or tickets can be got by searching for ‘Dromore West Sings’ on the website eventbrite.com.
Sympathy
Deepest sympathy is extended to Gabrielle Hoban and the Hoban Family Doonflynn, Skreen on the recent death of her Aunt Betty Gallagher, late of New York, USA.
Open evening
Highpark National School, Skreen is having an open evening for new pupils on February 10 at 7pm.
All those with an interest in sending their child to the school are most welcome to come and meet the teachers, the parents association and view the school facilities.
